Comment: Morphy's favorite opening move as White.
A nontraditional second move, preparing for P-Q4.
The amateur, logically, attacks the unguarded KP.
Black goes in for the exchange of KP's...
Seemingly preparing to castle. However, he never does get a chance to and ends up paying the price.
Normally a Queen move this early is bad, but this one has a disorganizing effect on Black's position. He now must move or defend his Knight, and because of White's KP, he has few options.
Again leaving Black with few viable options.
6... NxR 7 QxR ch K-K2, offering an exchange of Queens to break the attack, might be an alternative. I haven't analyzed the continuations. Black doesn't seem to have many good moves.
Now Morphy attacks the trapped Q.
Black has little choice. 7... B-K2 loses the Knight on B7.
Threatening a number of nasty things. 8... NxR, freeing the B to defend the threatened K-side, may well be the best move of a bad lot for Black.
Desperate, Black gives up his Rook in an attempt to break the attack.
Morphy's attack loses none of its force.
The only way to stop BxQ.
Black resigns. 10... B-B1 [forced] allows 11 BxQ after all, leaving Morphy with a tremendous material advantage.
